description: A lanBlazer7000SystemTrap is sent by the agent when a system
event is triggered. These events are usually triggered
when the software encounters an unexpected situation
e.g. a hardware failure or a software bug.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000SystemTrap ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapEventIndex i 9999 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapTime t 31536000 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapDescr s EXAMPLE ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapType i 1 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapSeverity i 0 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapDTM s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAM ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResType i 1 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResLeaf i 9999 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapValueType i 1 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapValue s EXAMPLE ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapEpochTime i 9999 ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapID i 9999

description: The index that uniquely identifies the event that caused this trap.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapEventIndex

description: The value of sysUpTime when this event was triggered.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapTime

description: The event log description.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapDescr

description: The type of event that caused this trap.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapType

description: The severity associated with this event. It is recommended that the
severity be interpreted in the following manner:
0-19: Normal
20-39: Informational
40-59: Warning
60-79: Alarm
80-99: Severe Error
100: Failure.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapSeverity

description: The date and time when this trap was sent. The format is yy-Mon-
dd hh:mm:ss, time is in 24 hour time.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapDTM

description: The type of object (if provided) that triggered this event. If not provided
the value is equal to 'Invalid Resource'.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResType

description: The instance of this resource (if provided - see lanBlazer7000EventTrapResType)
that triggered this event.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResID

description: A number corresponding to the attribute associated with this resource and
this event entry. It corresponds exactly to the leaf MIB number of the MIB
that manages this resource. For example, if a port's mode changed, the
configuration event log entry would indicate the value of 5 which is the
leaf index of the lanBlazer7000PortMode within the lanBlazer7000PortTable MIB table.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResLeaf

description: The data type associated with the trap event value. This object indicates
how to interpret the data stored in the event trap value:
- none(1) indicates no value returned.
- integer32(2) - a 4 byte unsigned integer.
- integer64(3) - an 8 byte unsigned integer.
- displayString(4) - a null terminated (or up to 8 characters) string.
- ipv4NetworkAddress(5) - a 4 byte IP version 4 network address.
- ieee802MACAddress(6) - a 6 byte MAC Address.
- timeticks(7) - sysUpTime type value (4 bytes)
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapValueType

description: The value associated with the event encoded in an octet string. Refer to
lanBlazer7000EventTrapValueType for how to interpret this value.
The value encoded in this string is in Big Endian order.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapValue

description: The number of time ticks since the epoch when this
event was logged. The interpretation of this value is
as follows:
struct DateTimeOvly {
UNS32 year:6;
UNS32 month:4;
UNS32 day:5;
UNS32 hour:5;
UNS32 minute:6;
UNS32 second:6;
The epoch is January 1, 1997, at 00:00:00. A value of
0 refers to this date and time.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapEpochTime

description: A unique index that identifies the occurence of this
event. This ID can be correlated between traps, logs
and the like.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapID

description: A lanBlazer7000ConfigurationTrap is sent by the agent when the
configuration event is triggered. These events are
triggered when a configuration change is made.

description: A lanBlazer7000TemperatureTrap is sent by the agent when the
temperature event is triggered. This event is
triggered when a temperature probe detects the
temperature crossing a threshold.

description: A lanBlazer7000ResourceTrap is sent by the agent when the
resource event is triggered. The resource event is
triggered when a resource is added or removed from the
system.

description: The instance of this resource (if provided - see lanBlazer7000EventTrapResType)
that triggered this event.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResID

description: A number corresponding to the attribute associated with this resource and
this event entry. It corresponds exactly to the leaf MIB number of the MIB
that manages this resource. For example, if a port's mode changed, the
configuration event log entry would indicate the value of 5 which is the
leaf index of the lanBlazer7000PortMode within the lanBlazer7000PortTable MIB table.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapResLeaf

description: The data type associated with the trap event value. This object indicates
how to interpret the data stored in the event trap value:
- none(1) indicates no value returned.
- integer32(2) - a 4 byte unsigned integer.
- integer64(3) - an 8 byte unsigned integer.
- displayString(4) - a null terminated (or up to 8 characters) string.
- ipv4NetworkAddress(5) - a 4 byte IP version 4 network address.
- ieee802MACAddress(6) - a 6 byte MAC Address.
- timeticks(7) - sysUpTime type value (4 bytes)
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapValueType

description: The value associated with the event encoded in an octet string. Refer to
lanBlazer7000EventTrapValueType for how to interpret this value.
The value encoded in this string is in Big Endian order.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapValue

description: The number of time ticks since the epoch when this
event was logged. The interpretation of this value is
as follows:
struct DateTimeOvly {
UNS32 year:6;
UNS32 month:4;
UNS32 day:5;
UNS32 hour:5;
UNS32 minute:6;
UNS32 second:6;
The epoch is January 1, 1997, at 00:00:00. A value of
0 refers to this date and time.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapEpochTime

description: A unique index that identifies the occurence of this
event. This ID can be correlated between traps, logs
and the like.
variables.name: ODSLANBlazer7000-MIB::lanBlazer7000EventTrapID
